page.title: 10CAMBRIDGE (Continued)
page.content: With several farms around the Village, farming is the main occupation although not all of the farms are of the traditional variety - one has been given over to growing fruit (mostly strawberries) for the "pick your own" market and another has turned some of its fields into a residential and touring caravan site with some space for campers. With the coming of the main A 38 Trunk Road the Village Hall and the School disappeared - these facilities are now shared with nearby Slimbridge - and the only leisure activity apart from walking is fishing on the River Cam which runs through the middle of the village (and from which the village derives its name). In spite of several bus services Cambridge is an isolated village and is likely to remain so.
